channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [JCR-2344] ClassCastException org.apache.xerces.parsers.XIncludeAwareParserConfiguration cannot be cast to org.apache.xerces.xni.parser.XMLParserConfiguration when deploying in JBoss 5.1
item.description:
I tried to follow the steps given on http://wiki.apache.org/jackrabbit/JackrabbitOnJBoss
To get over an exception I had to use jcr-2.0.jar (instead of jcr-1.0.jar)
The following exception happens when the jboss server is started.
=======================================================================

2009-10-02 11:49:05,630 ERROR [org.jboss.web.tomcat.service.deployers.JBossContextConfig] (main) XML error parsing: context.xml
org.jboss.xb.binding.JBossXBRuntimeException: Failed to create a new SAX parser

item.summary: ClassCastException org.apache.xerces.parsers.XIncludeAwareParserConfiguration cannot be cast to org.apache.xerces.xni.parser.XMLParserConfiguration when deploying in JBoss 5.1

comments.comment: Fixed in revision 935544 by removing the Xerces dependency from Jackrabbit.

Also the xml-apis jar that we get as a transitive dependency through Tika (and POI and dom4j) causes problems with JBoss. I excluded the dependency in revision 935663. We can drop the exclusion rule when we upgrade to Tika 0.8, see TIKA-412.
